verses.verse: In God I have put my trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
Vows made to You are binding upon me, O God; I will render praises to You,
(Ps. 116:8, 9) For You have delivered my soul from death. Have You not kept my feet from falling, That I may walk before God In the (Job 33:30) light of the living?

(Prayer for Safety from Enemies) To the Chief Musician. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” A Michtam of David (1 Sam. 22:1) when he fled from Saul into the cave. [1] Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me! For my soul trusts in You; (Ruth 2:12; Ps. 17:8; 63:7) And in the shadow of Your wings I will make my refuge, (Is. 26:20) Until these calamities have passed by.
I will cry out to God Most High, To God ((Ps. 138:8)) who performs all things for me.
(Ps. 144:5, 7) He shall send from heaven and save me; He reproaches the one who would swallow me up. Selah God (Ps. 43:3) shall send forth His mercy and His truth.
My soul is among lions; I lie among the sons of men Who are set on fire, (Prov. 30:14) Whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
(Ps. 108:5) Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let Your glory be above all the earth.
(Ps. 9:15) They have prepared a net for my steps; My soul is bowed down; They have dug a pit before me; Into the midst of it they themselves have fallen. Selah
(Ps. 108:1-5) My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and give praise.
Awake, (Ps. 16:9) my glory! Awake, lute and harp! I will awaken the dawn.
